definition: to present to a superior/memorial/petition/to present (a certain appearance)/to assume (a shape)/to be (a certain color)
to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)

sentences.english: For your purple soul in Acheron.
sentences.chinese: 呈給你黃土下紫色的靈魂。

sentences.english: With that, he held up the leaves and the goblet to show the king.
sentences.chinese: 說完了之後，他拿出葉子和酒杯呈給國王看。

sentences.english: For your gentle face stained with dirt.
sentences.chinese: 呈給你泥黑的溫柔的臉顏。

sentences.english: Mulan tried to find someone to help her as Shang presented Shan-Yu'ssword to the Emperor.
sentences.chinese: 李翔把單于的劍呈給皇帝，木蘭也正在四處找人幫忙。

sentences.english: At last Josef entered the palace and presented his gift to the gracious tsarina.
sentences.chinese: 約瑟夫終於進入宮中把禮物呈給和藹的皇后。

sentences.english: For you, Dayanhe, who loved me as your own son.
sentences.chinese: 呈給愛我如愛她自己的兒子般的大堰河。

sentences.english: Dedicated to your face, warm and soft, the color of with.
sentences.chinese: 呈給你泥黑的溫柔的臉顏。
